title: Chinese government donates anti-epidemic materials to the Libyan government in June 2020
description: On June 10, 2020, anti-Covid-19 materials donated by the Chinese government arrived at Carthage International Airport in Tunisia. On June 11, a handover ceremony was held for the donation at the Chinese Embassy in Tunisia. Chargé d'affaires ad interim of the Chinese embassy in Libya, Wang Qimin, and Chargé d'affaires ad interim of the Libyan embassy in Tunisia, Khalifa Azabi, signed the handover certificate.  The aid included 834 nucleic acid diagnostic kits, 5,000 medical protective suits, 15,000 N95 masks, 100,000 surgical masks, 5,000 goggles, and 5,000 pairs of medical gloves. The exact monetary value of the donation is unknown.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese government donates anti-epidemic materials to the Libyan government in June 2020

# Description
On June 10, 2020, anti-Covid-19 materials donated by the Chinese government arrived at Carthage International Airport in Tunisia. On June 11, a handover ceremony was held for the donation at the Chinese Embassy in Tunisia. Chargé d'affaires ad interim of the Chinese embassy in Libya, Wang Qimin, and Chargé d'affaires ad interim of the Libyan embassy in Tunisia, Khalifa Azabi, signed the handover certificate.  The aid included 834 nucleic acid diagnostic kits, 5,000 medical protective suits, 15,000 N95 masks, 100,000 surgical masks, 5,000 goggles, and 5,000 pairs of medical gloves. The exact monetary value of the donation is unknown.
justification: Project is a humanitarian aid donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of medical supplies for COVID-19 response, health sector focus

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 337.9 million government concessional loan for Telecommunications Network Modernization Project
description: On December 2, 2019, China Eximbank and the Government of Madagascar signed a preferential loan framework agreement for the Telecommunications Network Modernization Project. Then, on February 19, 2020, China Eximbank and the Government of Madagascar signed a RMB 337,998,700 (USD 42.7 million) government concessional loan (GCL) agreement for the project. The GCL carries the following borrowing terms: a 30 year maturity, a 5 year grace period, a 1.5% interest rate, a 0.25% management fee, and a 0.25% commitment fee.   Madagascar’s Senate approved the loan agreement on June 5, 2020. This project involves the deployment of a fiber-optic network using Huawei’s 4G eLTE technology across public safety and other government agencies in the capital, Antananarivo. This project also involves the creation of data management centers and the installation of software and equipment, including video-conferencing technology and surveillance cameras, intended to improve public services and reduce the cost of internal telecommunications within public administration. Huawei Technologies is the contractor responsible for implementation.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is “援马通讯网络现代化”项目. The French project title is le Projet de modernisation du réseau de télécommunication à Madagascar or Modernisation du réseau de télécommunication de Madagascar.
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
China Eximbank provides RMB 337.9 million government concessional loan for Telecommunications Network Modernization Project

# Description
On December 2, 2019, China Eximbank and the Government of Madagascar signed a preferential loan framework agreement for the Telecommunications Network Modernization Project. Then, on February 19, 2020, China Eximbank and the Government of Madagascar signed a RMB 337,998,700 (USD 42.7 million) government concessional loan (GCL) agreement for the project. The GCL carries the following borrowing terms: a 30 year maturity, a 5 year grace period, a 1.5% interest rate, a 0.25% management fee, and a 0.25% commitment fee.   Madagascar’s Senate approved the loan agreement on June 5, 2020. This project involves the deployment of a fiber-optic network using Huawei’s 4G eLTE technology across public safety and other government agencies in the capital, Antananarivo. This project also involves the creation of data management centers and the installation of software and equipment, including video-conferencing technology and surveillance cameras, intended to improve public services and reduce the cost of internal telecommunications within public administration. Huawei Technologies is the contractor responsible for implementation.
justification: Project focuses on telecommunications network modernization without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Deployment of fiber-optic network, data management centers, and government communication systems

title: Chinese Government donates first batch of anti-COVID-19 pandemic medical supplies to Madagascar in May 2020 (linked to project ID#91915 and 91912)
description: On May 2, 2020, the Chinese Ambassador to Madagascar Yang Xiaorong went to Ivato International Airport to attend the handover ceremony of the first batch of anti-pandemic material projects from the Chinese government to Madagascar. He signed the project handover certificate with the Madagascar Minister of Public Health Ahmad Amhad on behalf of the two governments. Minister of Transport of Madagascar, Deputy Secretary-General of the Presidential Office, and Economic and Commercial Counselor Liang Shaomin attended the ceremony. According to FOCAC,  the donation included surgical and N95-type masks, protective suits, thermometers, goggles, gloves and shoe covers for health professionals. The monetary value of the donation was not specified.     The second donation was received in July 2020 (see project ID#91915), and the third donation was received in August 2020 (see project ID#91912).
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government donates first batch of anti-COVID-19 pandemic medical supplies to Madagascar in May 2020 (linked to project ID#91915 and 91912)

# Description
On May 2, 2020, the Chinese Ambassador to Madagascar Yang Xiaorong went to Ivato International Airport to attend the handover ceremony of the first batch of anti-pandemic material projects from the Chinese government to Madagascar. He signed the project handover certificate with the Madagascar Minister of Public Health Ahmad Amhad on behalf of the two governments. Minister of Transport of Madagascar, Deputy Secretary-General of the Presidential Office, and Economic and Commercial Counselor Liang Shaomin attended the ceremony. According to FOCAC,  the donation included surgical and N95-type masks, protective suits, thermometers, goggles, gloves and shoe covers for health professionals. The monetary value of the donation was not specified.     The second donation was received in July 2020 (see project ID#91915), and the third donation was received in August 2020 (see project ID#91912).
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for pandemic response, unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Donation of surgical masks, N95 masks, protective suits, thermometers, goggles, gloves, and shoe covers for health professionals

title: The Chinese Embassy in Madagascar donates emergency humanitarian aid to Southern Madagascar in December 2020
description: On December 11th, 2020, The handover ceremony of the emergency humanitarian aid supplies from the Chinese Embassy in Madagascar to the southern region of Madagascar was held at the Prime Minister's Office. The donations included 15 tons of koba, 15 tons of cracked corn, 2.5 tons of white beans, 6 500-liter water tanks, 200 20-liter buckets, 5,000 plates, and 5,000 scoops.The Chinese Ambassador to Madagascar, Guo Xiaomei, Prime Minister Entsai of Madagascar, and Minister of Water Affairs and Cleansing of Malagasy, Racutuveluma Nanchua, attended the ceremony. The donations will be distributed through the National Office of Risk and Disaster Management (French: Bureau National de Gestion des Risques et Catastrophes), the national disaster-management office.
combined_text:
# Sector
DISASTER PREVENTION AND PREPAREDNESS

# Title
The Chinese Embassy in Madagascar donates emergency humanitarian aid to Southern Madagascar in December 2020

# Description
On December 11th, 2020, The handover ceremony of the emergency humanitarian aid supplies from the Chinese Embassy in Madagascar to the southern region of Madagascar was held at the Prime Minister's Office. The donations included 15 tons of koba, 15 tons of cracked corn, 2.5 tons of white beans, 6 500-liter water tanks, 200 20-liter buckets, 5,000 plates, and 5,000 scoops.The Chinese Ambassador to Madagascar, Guo Xiaomei, Prime Minister Entsai of Madagascar, and Minister of Water Affairs and Cleansing of Malagasy, Racutuveluma Nanchua, attended the ceremony. The donations will be distributed through the National Office of Risk and Disaster Management (French: Bureau National de Gestion des Risques et Catastrophes), the national disaster-management office.
justification: Project is focused on humanitarian aid and disaster relief without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Emergency humanitarian aid supplies including food, water tanks, and basic necessities for disaster relief

title: Chinese Government donates the third batch of anti-COVID-19 pandemic medical supplies to Madagascar in August 2020 (linked to project ID#91877 and 91915)
description: On August 19th, 2020, China donated 30 respirators and 20,000 PCR test kits to Madagascar. Chen Xiaolei, Chargé d'Affaires of the Chinese Embassy in Madagascar, went to Iwatu International Airport in Antananarivo to attend the handover ceremony of the anti-epidemic materials. Duval Solofomanana, the secretary-general of Madagascar's Ministry of Health, was also present at the handover ceremony.  The first batch was received in May 2020 (see project ID#91877), and the second batch was received in July 2020 (see project ID#91915)
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government donates the third batch of anti-COVID-19 pandemic medical supplies to Madagascar in August 2020 (linked to project ID#91877 and 91915)

# Description
On August 19th, 2020, China donated 30 respirators and 20,000 PCR test kits to Madagascar. Chen Xiaolei, Chargé d'Affaires of the Chinese Embassy in Madagascar, went to Iwatu International Airport in Antananarivo to attend the handover ceremony of the anti-epidemic materials. Duval Solofomanana, the secretary-general of Madagascar's Ministry of Health, was also present at the handover ceremony.  The first batch was received in May 2020 (see project ID#91877), and the second batch was received in July 2020 (see project ID#91915)
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for public health purposes, unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Donation of respirators and PCR test kits for COVID-19 response, healthcare sector focus

title: The Chinese Embassy in Madagascar donates books and audiovisual materials to the National Library in Madagascar
description: On December 17th, 2020, The Chinese Embassy in Madagascar donated 991 books, 80 easels and audio-visual materials to Madagascar's National Library. The books became part of the library's international corner, which has books about politics, history, science, and culture of various countries. The donation was received by Madagascar's Ministry of Communications.
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
The Chinese Embassy in Madagascar donates books and audiovisual materials to the National Library in Madagascar

# Description
On December 17th, 2020, The Chinese Embassy in Madagascar donated 991 books, 80 easels and audio-visual materials to Madagascar's National Library. The books became part of the library's international corner, which has books about politics, history, science, and culture of various countries. The donation was received by Madagascar's Ministry of Communications.
justification: Project involves donation of educational materials with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of books and audiovisual materials to National Library, focus on education and cultural exchange
